page.title: 10Hatfield Broad Oak School
page.content: St. Mary's Church of England Aided Primary School was founded in 1862 and the original building and school house date from that time. The new building which contains the assembly hall, two classrooms, staffroom and office was opened in 1966. There is a separate canteen and an open-air learners' swimming pool heated by Calor gas. There are at present 40 children on roll, taught in two classes. The age range is from 4+ to 11. The staff consists of headmaster and deputy head full time plus a part time teacher at present working 12.5 hours per week. In addition there are a secretary and a welfare assistant who work 9 and 16 hours per week respectively. The school is well-equipped both with books and audio-visual aids including a television, video recorder and computer.
